Description: Mould-made pottery oil-lamp with plain discus surrounded with a ring. Surrounding the ridge, on the shoulder, is a ring of inscribed circles. Between the wick-hole and discus-rim are small volutes. At the rear is a pierced notched handle, broken and partially lost. On the base of the oil-lamp 'CE' is inscribed. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with mica and white inclusions. Surface is discoloured black in places, probably during firing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Nottingham Castle Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

2nd to mid 4th century AD parallels from Tell Atrib (Młynarczyk 2012, type TA V.5). Mid 2nd to 4th century AD parallels in the British Museum (Bailey 1988, Q2066-73). Młynarczyk, J. 2012. Tell Atrib 1985-1995. Vol. 3: Terracotta oil lamps. Varsovie: Éditions Neriton.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.34) (Phase 3)
